ABNL is a 100% owned indigenous firm, with a shareholding in excess of 100 million Naira. The integrity of the directors and the staff of the company have been a priceless contributive factor in the growth and wellbeing of the company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Safety, Health, and Environmental - Security Operations Analyst III
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Contract

Main Functions


	The role of the Security Operations Analyst can be summarized as the processing and management of information.
	The Security Operations Analyst is the Security and Community Affairs (CA) focal point for all community and social information relating to, and impacting on, the company&#39;s interests across locally, not just for the project.


Tasks &amp; Responsibilities


	The primary role of the Security Operations Analyst is to ensure effective communication and information flow between the Security Department and the CA Department.
	This includes the collation and communication of relevant information captured by Community Affairs and Public &amp; Government Affairs to the Security Department.
	The role includes the requirement to produce written and verbal reports providing statistical data as well as analysis and comment on community-related issues, incidents and threats impacting on the company
	The timely production and dissemination of these reports is critical and will require the Operations Analyst to prioritize tasking in order to meet the deadlines and provide near real time reporting.
	The Security Operations Analyst will also provide comment and analysis of trends and key issues relating to community and social issues, and threats impacting upon the company and/or the Project as well as comment on threat agents.
	The Security Operations Analyst will provide proactive advice on community and social issues to the Security Manager and, where tasked, to Global Security.
	The Security Operations Analyst will supervise and train the Data Analyst to better share job workload and to become competent in all requirements of the Security Operations Analyst role.
	Use approved software to generate reports and data as required.
	As directed by the Security Manager, the Operations Analyst will conduct field trips to the different sites.


Skills &amp; Requirements

	Experience in the collation, analysis and dissemination of data related to security, community and social issues
	Exceptional skill in all aspects of report preparation, including concept, design and production

Safety, Health, and Environmental - Security Operations Analyst III Job at ABNL Limited




        
    

        
        ABNL Limited was incorporated in 1992 as an Oil and Gas servicing company with a vision to provide professional engineering and technical services to the Oil and Gas exploration and production companies in Nigeria and the West African sub-region. Since its incorporation, the company has grown in leaps and bounds, expanding its business horizon, but still within the Oil and Gas sector.
     

            
    



ABNL is a 100% owned indigenous firm, with a shareholding in excess of 100 million Naira. Its' directors are individuals of proven integrity, who over the years have acquired the requisite experience in the Oil and Gas business, as well as in the banking and finance sector. The integrity of the directors and the staff of the company have been a priceless contributive factor in the growth and wellbeing of the company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Safety, Health, and Environmental - Security Operations Analyst III
Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Contract

Main Functions


	The role of the Security Operations Analyst can be summarized as the processing and management of information.
	The Security Operations Analyst is the Security and Community Affairs (CA) focal point for all community and social information relating to, and impacting on, the company's interests across locally, not just for the project.


Tasks & Responsibilities


	The primary role of the Security Operations Analyst is to ensure effective communication and information flow between the Security Department and the CA Department.
	This includes the collation and communication of relevant information captured by Community Affairs and Public & Government Affairs to the Security Department.
	The role includes the requirement to produce written and verbal reports providing statistical data as well as analysis and comment on community-related issues, incidents and threats impacting on the company
	The timely production and dissemination of these reports is critical and will require the Operations Analyst to prioritize tasking in order to meet the deadlines and provide near real time reporting.
	The Security Operations Analyst will also provide comment and analysis of trends and key issues relating to community and social issues, and threats impacting upon the company and/or the Project as well as comment on threat agents.
	The Security Operations Analyst will provide proactive advice on community and social issues to the Security Manager and, where tasked, to Global Security.
	The Security Operations Analyst will supervise and train the Data Analyst to better share job workload and to become competent in all requirements of the Security Operations Analyst role.
	Use approved software to generate reports and data as required.
	As directed by the Security Manager, the Operations Analyst will conduct field trips to the different sites.


Skills & Requirements


	Superior analytical and conceptual skills
	Experience in the collation, analysis and dissemination of data related to security, community and social issues
	Exceptional skill in all aspects of report preparation, including concept, design and production
	Well-developed written and oral communication skills
	Ability to deliver succinct and effective presentations
	Demonstrated ability to work well in a team environment
	Demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines without supervision
	Ability to respond to task related pressure – in particular to compressed timelines
	Demonstrated high competency with MS Word, PowerPoint and Excel
	Commitment to Safety, Security, Health, and Environment (SSHE) principles
	Detailed knowledge of managing i2 software or equivalent


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resumes (in MS Word format) to: jobs@abnl.net using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Sales Representative Job at CWAY Group




        
    

        
        CWAY Group is a multinational conglomerate, headquartered in Lagos state Nigeria. The sectorial investments is in emerging diverse businesses including Food and Beverages, Drinking Water and Snacks.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Representative
Job Location: Lagos

Job Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Develop and implement sales and marketing strategy and plan to ensure profit maximization and excellent customer service. Ensure the achievement of sales targets.
	Ensure product availability and visibility in trade through enforcement of healthy stock level in distributor’s warehouse and retailers stores, HORECA & Key Account according to company standard.
	Ensure that pricing structure reflect market reality when compared with competitors and drive new product development.
	Identify, nurture and harness new business opportunities to grow market shares through monitoring trend and development in market place and ensure customers satisfaction.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual sales report according to sales director and company set standard.
	Provide supervision through field visits, observations and measurement of results to include performance appraisals and salary reviews.
	Develop competencies and processes required to create an effective and efficient sales force.
	Create and implement effective direct and indirect sales strategies to develop neighborhood sales strategy towards the achievement of sales goals.
	Establish effective relationships and collaborations with other departments (production, Finance & Logistics) to address key business issues and opportunities. Communicate the company Food safety policy, requirements to customers and end users. Ensure outlets conform with food safety requirements, product storage, vehicle/logistics conditions and conduct/analyse customer feedback survey annually. Carry out product recall/withdrawal when necessary.


Job Requirements


	First degree in a relevant field.
	At least 2 years of experience in the FMCG sector, with at 1 year must be in Table Water sales.
	Must be numerate and familiar with data analysis and reporting. Must be a person of a high level of integrity and enthusiasm

title: Job Openings at Prince O J Global Services Limited

content:
Prince O J Global Services Limited is a fast consumer goods company incorporated in Nigeria with head office in Onitsha Anambra state, We deal on importation and distribution of top quality wines and spirits, spices, tomato, spaghetti, oil, margarine, baking powder, liquid milk and many more.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Representative

Job Location: Asaba, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Drive sales by setting goals, developing sales strategies and implementing them so as to meet and exceed monthly target
	Provide accurate and up-to-date information to customers regarding our products, pricing, delivery options, and after-sales services.
	Monitor market trends and competitors' activities to identify potential business opportunities
	Ability to conquer your territory and beyond as well as push in new products in the market.
	Ability to acquirenew customers as well as maintain existing customers


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree or HND in a related field.
	Must be computer literate
	Proven experience in sales, preferably in FMCG Company
	Strong leadership skills and the ability to effectively manage a team
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Ability to build and maintain long-lasting customer relationships
	Goal-oriented mindset and a driven personality
	Self-motivated and results-driven with a strong work ethic
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 Monthly. 

Application Closing Date: 30th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@ojglobalservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Male / Female Internal Auditor

Job Location: Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Evaluate internal controls to prevent fraud
	Ensure accuracy
	Identify risks and report findings
	Review and verify the accuracy and reliability of financial statements
	Ensure that financial records, operational procedures and business practices adhere to relevant laws, regulations and accounting standards
	Meticulously document audit procedures, findings and conclusions to maintain an audit trail.
	Conduct follow-up audits to ensure that corrective actions recommended in previous reports have been implemented and other related activities.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree or HND in a related field
	Must be computer literate
	Proven experience in audit activities
	Strong leadership skills
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Goal oriented mindset and a driven personality
	Ability to work independently and as a team


Application Closing Date: 30th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@ojglobalservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Supply Chain Officer 

Job Location: Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities


	Resolving supply chain distribution.
	Record Keeping.
	Inventory management.
	Logistics and distribution.
	Procurement.
	Data entry and analysis.
	Supplier Relationships Management.
	Ensure that all supply chain activities comply with company policies, legal requirements and industry standard.
	Prepares report on supply chain performance and provides data-driven insights for decision making and others related activities.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in a related field.
	1 - 5 years of relevant work experience.
	Must be computer literate.
	Proven experience in chain supply management in FMCG company.
	Strong leadership skills and ability to effectively manage a team.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to build and maintain long lasting customer relationship.
	Goal oriented mindset and a driven personality.
	Ability to work independently.
